items.description:
Happy Friday Everyone, and a happy turkey day to those in the US.

So many great resources in this weeks edition, including adding Widgets to your Xamarin.Forms apps, and a bunch of great videos to watch.

Have a great weekend

❤

Kym
items.description_markdown:
Happy Friday Everyone, and a happy turkey day to those in the US.

items.title: Can your app be installed on the Apple Silicon Macs
items.description:
Apple announced that the new Mac computers with the ARM 64 processor will be able to install compatible iOS & iPad apps. What does that mean, and how can you tell if your app is compatible?

Trick to see if your iOS app can be installed on the Apple Silicon Macs by The First Prototype
items.description_markdown:
Apple announced that the new Mac computers with the ARM 64 processor will be able to install compatible iOS & iPad apps. What does that mean, and how can you tell if your app is compatible?

[**Trick to see if your iOS app can be installed on the Apple Silicon Macs**](https://prototypemakers.medium.com/doyouriosappsinstallonthenewmacs-18e5248cb3b9) by [The First Prototype](https://prototypemakers.medium.com)

embedded_links.title: **Trick to see if your iOS app can be installed on the Apple Silicon Macs**

items.title: iOS 14 Widgets with Xamarin Forms
items.description:
As you probably know, Apple’s latest iOS 14 and iPadOS 14 introduced the ability for developers to add widgets to their home screens. This is great news if your app can benefit from the addition of widgets.

iOS 14 Widgets with Xamarin Forms by Michael Dimoudis
items.description_markdown:
As you probably know, Apple’s latest iOS 14 and iPadOS 14 introduced the ability for developers to add widgets to their home screens. This is great news if your app can benefit from the addition of widgets.

[**iOS 14 Widgets with Xamarin Forms**](https://medium.com/@michaeldimoudis/ios-14-widgets-with-xamarin-forms-e186d24a0638) by [Michael Dimoudis](https://michaeldimoudis.medium.com)

items.title: Forcing single SwipeViews
items.description:
Rick had a need to a collection of SwipeViews on a page, where it is only possible to have a single SwipeView swiped open. Here's how he achieved it.

An innovation company by Rick van Dijk
items.description_markdown:
Rick had a need to a collection of SwipeViews on a page, where it is only possible to have a single SwipeView swiped open. Here's how he achieved it.

items.title: Simplifying Bindable Properties with Type Converters in Xamarin Forms
items.description:
A Type Converter allows you to convert values from a type to a different type, this is helpful when creating bindable properties in Xamarin Forms because it saves you a lot of time and validation code. In this article, Charlin shows you a few use cases where you can use it.

Simplifying Bindable Properties with Type Converters in Xamarin Forms by Charlin Agramonte
items.description_markdown:
A Type Converter allows you to convert values from a type to a different type, this is helpful when creating bindable properties in Xamarin Forms because it saves you a lot of time and validation code. In this article, Charlin shows you a few use cases where you can use it.

[**Simplifying Bindable Properties with Type Converters in Xamarin Forms**](https://xamgirl.com/simplifying-bindable-properties-with-type-converters-in-xamarin-forms/) by [Charlin Agramonte](https://twitter.com/chard003)

embedded_links.title: **Simplifying Bindable Properties with Type Converters in Xamarin Forms**

items.title: Reverse engineering published Xamarin Forms apps.
items.description:
You should always be aware that storing secrets in your client side is a dangerous thing. In this post Angel Garcia shows how easy it is to crack open an App. Most importantly, he covers some guidelines you should follow to protect your secrets.

Don’t put sensitive data in the client side: Reverse engineering published Xamarin Forms apps. by Angel Garcia
items.description_markdown:
You should always be aware that storing secrets in your client side is a dangerous thing. In this post Angel Garcia shows how easy it is to crack open an App.  Most importantly, he covers some guidelines you should follow to protect your secrets.

[**Don’t put sensitive data in the client side: Reverse engineering published Xamarin Forms apps.**](http://talkwithangel.com/dont-put-sensitive-data-in-the-client-side-reverse-engineering-published-xamarin-forms-apps/) by [Angel Garcia](http://talkwithangel.com/author/angelrenegarcia13/)

embedded_links.title: **Don’t put sensitive data in the client side: Reverse engineering published Xamarin Forms apps.**

items.title: Toronto Mobile Devs Meetup - Microsoft Identity for Mobile Devs
items.description:

TO Mobile Devs Meetup - 2020-11-17 - Microsoft Identity for Mobile Devs by Toronto Mobile Developers
items.description_markdown:

items.title: Retrieving and Deserializing JSON
items.description:
Getting data from a remote server or REST API is a big part of any app. In this video we will learn how to get JSON data from an ASP.NET Core Web API and deserialize that.

Retrieving and Deserializing JSON in Your Xamarin.Forms App by Gerald Versluis
items.description_markdown:
Getting data from a remote server or REST API is a big part of any app. In this video we will learn how to get JSON data from an ASP.NET Core Web API and deserialize that. 

[**Retrieving and Deserializing JSON in Your Xamarin.Forms App**](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rq3iok03q7E) by [Gerald Versluis](https://twitter.com/jfversluis)

embedded_links.title: **Retrieving and Deserializing JSON in Your Xamarin.Forms App**

items.title: 5 Things about Xamarin.Forms 5
items.description:
Xamarin.Forms 5 is almost here and it has some surprising changes that you need to be aware of! In this video, we will see what are the 5 most notable changes and I will talk you through what that means to you.

5 Things You Need to Know About Xamarin.Forms 5, Right Now! by Gerald Versluis
items.description_markdown:
Xamarin.Forms 5 is almost here and it has some surprising changes that you need to be aware of! In this video, we will see what are the 5 most notable changes and I will talk you through what that means to you.

[**5 Things You Need to Know About Xamarin.Forms 5, Right Now!**](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=O-VIsLDEplQ) by [Gerald Versluis](https://twitter.com/jfversluis)

embedded_links.title: **5 Things You Need to Know About Xamarin.Forms 5, Right Now!**

items.description_markdown:
If you have upgraded Visual Studio you might have noticed that GitHub accounts are now integrated into Visual Studio 2019 with a fully integrated GitHub account experience.

items.title: Announcing Azure Mobile Apps v4.2.0 for .NET
items.description:
The Azure Mobile Apps client libraries enabled you to provide online and offline sync of cloud SQL data to your apps. The recent release of v4.2.0 updated all core platforms.

Announcing Azure Mobile Apps v4.2.0 for .NET by Adrian Hall
items.description_markdown:
The Azure Mobile Apps client libraries enabled you to provide online and offline sync of cloud SQL data to your apps. The recent release of v4.2.0 updated all core platforms.

[**Announcing Azure Mobile Apps v4.2.0 for .NET**](https://devblogs.microsoft.com/xamarin/azure-mobile-apps-updates/) by [Adrian Hall](https://devblogs.microsoft.com/xamarin/author/adhal/)
